titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Johannes Eldert papers 1977.651
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:17:28 +0000.

did.abstract: The collection includes an inventory of items in the home of Thomas W. Hunt in the town of New Lots (which later became part of the East New York neighborhood of Brooklyn), taken by Johannes Eldert in exchange for $75 rent that Hunt owed; and an inventory of goods of Margaret Eldert's estate. Margaret Eldert died in Brooklyn in 1817.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Johannes Eldert papers, 1977.651, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The papers were formally accessioned in 1977.
